citeinfo.origin: New York (N.Y.). Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications.
New York City Office of Technology and Innovation

pubinfo.publish: Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications

citeinfo.title: New York City Street Centerline, 2023

descript.abstract: New York City Street Centerline, 2023 is a line theme representing streets in New York City as of 2023. Columbia Libraries staff downloaded this dataset from NYC Open Data at https://data.cityofnewyork.us/City-Government/NYC-Street-Centerline-CSCL-/exjm-f27b and reformatted to the geopackage format in September of 2023. Additional information about the data may be found at https://github.com/CityOfNewYork/nyc-geo-metadata/blob/master/Metadata/Metadata_StreetCenterline.md
descript.purpose: Use of the data is for analytic and cartographic purposes.

cntorgp.cntorg: NYC Office of Technology and Innovation
NYC Office of Technology and Innovation

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.
A unique ID assigned to intersection to intersection stretches of a street.
Low value for the address range on the left side of the street segment, relative to the digitized direction of the segment.
High value for the address range on the left side of the street segment, relative to the digitized direction of the segment.
Low value for the address range on the right side of the street segment, relative to the digitized direction of the segment.
High value for the address range on the right side of the street segment, relative to the digitized direction of the segment.

A ten-digit number identifying the block face on the left hand side of a segment. Block Face is defined as one continuous side of a physical block that is intersected on that side by two other physical through streets. Blockface IDs were established by DoITT's consultants working on the planimetric feature classes for NYC. Blockface IDs will be maintained by DOT and DCP as part of future updates.

A ten-digit number identifying the block face on the right hand side of a segment. Block Face is defined as one continuous side of a physical block that is intersected on that side by two other physical through streets. Blockface IDs were established by DoITT's consultants working on the planimetric feature classes for NYC. Blockface IDs will be maintained by DOT and DCP as part of future updates.
Five-digit postal zip code for the right side of the street segment, relative to the digitized direction of the segment.
Five-digit postal zip code for the left side of the street segment, relative to the digitized direction of the segment.
Street Name added for cartographic labeling purposes.

Refers to the construction status of a street segment: Constructed, Paper, Under Construction, Demapped, or Paper Street Coincident with Boundary. 1 = Planned Private 2 = Constructed 3 = Paper 4 = Under Construction 5 = Demapped 9 = Paper Street Coincident with Boundary

Defines which segments are part of the bicycle network as defined by the NYC Department of Transportation. 1 = Class I 2 = Class II 3 = Class III 4 = Links 5 = Class I, II 6 = Class II, III 7 = Stairs 8 = Class I, III 9 = Class II, I 10 = Class III, I 11 = Class III, II
Numeric codes for NYC 5 boroughs. 1 = Manhattan 2 = Bronx 3 = Brooklyn 4 = Queens 5 = Staten Island
The width, in feet, of the paved area of the street
Date feature was created
Date the feature was last modified
Traffic Direction. Code indicating the flow of traffic relative to the street segment's address range. FT = With TF = Against TW = Two-Way NV = Non-Vehicular

Street Centerline roadway type. 1 = Street 2 = Highway 3 = Bridge 4 = Tunnel 5 = Boardwalk 6 = Path/Trail 7 = StepStreet 8 = Driveway 9 = Ramp 10 = Alley 11 = Unknown 12 = Non-Physical Street Segment 13 = U Turn 14 = Ferry Route

Numeric value indicating the vertical position of the feature's "from" node relative to grade level. 1 = Below Grade 1 2 = Below Grade 2 3 = Below Grade 3 4 = Below Grade 4 5 = Below Grade 5 6 = Below Grade 6 7 = Below Grade 7 8 = Below Grade 8 9 = Below Grade 9 10 = Below Grade 10 11 = Below Grade 11 12 = Below Grade 12 13 = At Grade 14 = Above Grade 1 15 = Above Grade 2 16 = Above Grade 3 17 = Below Grade 4 18 = Below Grade 5 19 = Below Grade 6 20 = Below Grade 7 21 = Below Grade 8 22 = Below Grade 9 23 = Below Grade 10 24 = Below Grade 11 25 = Below Grade 12 25 = Below Grade 12 26 = Below Grade 13 99 = Not Applicable

Numeric value indicating the vertical position of the feature's "to" node relative to grade level. 1 = Below Grade 1 2 = Below Grade 2 3 = Below Grade 3 4 = Below Grade 4 5 = Below Grade 5 6 = Below Grade 6 7 = Below Grade 7 8 = Below Grade 8 9 = Below Grade 9 10 = Below Grade 10 11 = Below Grade 11 12 = Below Grade 12 13 = At Grade 14 = Above Grade 1 15 = Above Grade 2 16 = Above Grade 3 17 = Below Grade 4 18 = Below Grade 5 19 = Below Grade 6 20 = Below Grade 7 21 = Below Grade 8 22 = Below Grade 9 23 = Below Grade 10 24 = Below Grade 11 25 = Below Grade 12 25 = Below Grade 12 26 = Below Grade 13 99 = Not Applicable
Department of Sanitation (DSNY) snow removal priority designation. V=Non-DSNY, C=Critical, H=Haulster, S=Sector

Traffic Direction for bicycle travel. Code indicating the flow of traffic relative to the street segment's address range. FT = With
TF = Against TW = Two-Way NV = Non-Vehicular
